page.title: 03Hampton Manor and Grounds
page.content: When approaching{Hampton}from the West along Solihull Road or Bickenhill Lane the densely wooded grounds of {Hampton Manor}perhaps give a reminder of the original{Forest of Arden.}These trees provide a backdrop to the village. Many of the trees were planted when the grounds were created and include many large specimens of native and introduced trees, including an Hungarian Oak and several species of Cedar. The Manor was built in 1855 to the design of W.E.Nesfield for{Sir} {Frederick Peel.}It was built in Tudor Gothic style with battlements. In 1872 a clock tower attached to the house by a covered passage was added. Today the Manor is used by{Hampton} {Manor Homes}for mentally handicapped girls.
